data.text:
~~~Increase open file limit on padb1-test: see https://rtcamp.com/tutorials/linux/increase-open-files-limit/~~~

---

Increased all limits from 65536 to 655360 in ```/etc/security/limits.conf```. Did not touch ```/etc/pam.d/common-session``` or ```/etc/sysctl.conf``` 

---

Increased ot 6553600, added session required pam_limits.so to ```/etc/pam.d/common-session``` and  ```/etc/pam.d/common-session-noninteractive```.
add ability to manually remove lock for data migration process. Add ability to find locked process.

data.text:
~~~ Currently, the delta sync is taking too long (because the query for the dates to import is taking too long). ~~~

---
This one is fixed, the query was running on the wrong parameter type (joda.Time instead of sql.Time). Thus it was querying complete nonsene.

data.text:
Write a cron job for this like below

12 * * * *  find $SPARK_HOME/work -cmin +1440 -prune -exec rm -rf {} \+
32 * * * *  find /tmp -type d -cmin +1440 -name "spark-*-*-*" -prune -exec rm -rf {} \+
52 * * * *  find $SPARK_LOCAL_DIR -mindepth 1 -maxdepth 1 -type d -cmin +1440 -name "spark-*-*-*" -prune -exec rm -rf {} \+

On 20 April 2015 at 23:12, N B <nb.nospam@gmail.com> wrote:
Hi all,

I had posed this query as part of a different thread but did not get a response there. So creating a new thread hoping to catch someone's attention.

We are experiencing this issue of shuffle files being left behind and not being cleaned up by Spark. Since this is a Spark streaming application, it is expected to stay up indefinitely, so shuffle files not being cleaned up is a big problem right now. Our max window size is 6 hours, so we have set up a cron job to clean up shuffle files older than 12 hours otherwise it will eat up all our disk space.

Please see the following. It seems the non-cleaning of shuffle files is being documented in 1.3.1. 

https://github.com/apache/spark/pull/5074/files
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPARK-5836


Also, for some reason, the following JIRAs that were reported as functional issues were closed as Duplicates of the above Documentation bug. Does this mean that this issue won't be tackled at all?

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPARK-3563
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPARK-4796
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPARK-6011

Any further insight into whether this is being looked into and meanwhile how to handle shuffle files will be greatly appreciated.

Thanks
NB

data.text:
This one is a working docker image for Nexus:
https://registry.hub.docker.com/u/davidkarlsen/sonatype-nexus-docker/

Run
docker pull davidkarlsen/sonatype-nexus-docker
docker run -p 8081:8081 davidkarlsen/sonatype-nexus-docker
(but be sure to have persistent fs)

old.desc:
Currently, calculation is done in a single run. Need to perform it based upon the schedule, integrated into regular calculation.

Option A) Provide HTTP-API to trigger PACS-SPARK from the current calculation process.
Option B) Have ZeroMQ-Queue to schedule jobs in PACS-Spark
Option C) Make PACS-SPARK the master for backend calculation, use Quartz-based scheduling, triggering "old" calculation where necessary.

Based upon option chosen, select on a UI/Dashboard/Messaging solution to
* give information on current system state
* allow re-scheduling
* allow restart of calculation (complete or partial)

* Implement Daily-Test-Routine (data identical/not-identical mail, tweet, whatever.)

cards.desc:
We (should) use Zabbix.

Currently, I'm writing to a local instance of InfluxDB (http://localhost:8083/), showing stuff with Grafana (http://localhost:8000/#/dashboard/db/pacs-spark)


Also: We should enhance Spark monitoring setup by adding "[ENVIRONMENT].[HOST].[APPLICATION]." - prefix in monitoring.properties-file when provisioning machine.

Also: Add domain metrics (e.g., using https://github.com/sjl/metrics-clojure) like

 * number of items (used, calculated)?
 * runtime
 * health-information

cards.desc:
check wether CDH is the right toolset?!

 * support is very cost intensive (so it's more likely a "make" instead of a "buy")
 * is all-or-nothing
 * does not integrate well into our Ops-Infrastructure (Zabbix, pmlog)
cards.name: Infrastructure II: have new cluster for "pacs on spark" in ABC-Street.

cards.desc:
* HA-Cluster infrastructure required
* Handle communication from Spark to HDFS
* Spark Driver is single point of failure at the moment
* Deal with MySQL-outages (retry writing data from RDD to MySQL)
